meanings.sent1: After the storm, they needed to resecure the windows with stronger locks.
meanings.sent2: The soldier quickly resecured the perimeter after the breach.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel had to resecure its acorn stash from the sneaky raccoon.
meanings.sent4: She felt the need to resecure her heart after the painful breakup.
meanings.sent5: The knight vowed to resecure the kingdom from any threats.

meanings.definition: To regain control or possession of something.
meanings.sent1: The detective had to resecure the stolen jewels before the thief escaped.
meanings.sent2: The teacher managed to resecure the attention of the distracted students.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to resecure its favorite toy from the playful puppy.
meanings.sent4: He needed to resecure his place as the leader of the team.
meanings.sent5: The hero had to resecure the magical amulet to save the kingdom.

meanings.sent1: The lifeguard had to resecure the swimming area after the shark sighting.
meanings.sent2: The parents resecured the gate to keep the toddler from wandering off.
meanings.sent3: The farmer needed to resecure the barn to protect the animals from the storm.
meanings.sent4: She always double-checked to resecure the seatbelt before driving.
meanings.sent5: The security guard worked to resecure the building during the blackout.
